If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
Connect from CentOS ver7 to Microsoft Windows 10.0.17666 using Enter-PSSession

```powershell
enter-pssession -hostname sapien01 -UserName max_t 
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
To be able to clear the console screen
```none
```

Actual behavior
---------------
It won't clear the screen. But will go to the top.
```none
The method or operation is not implemented.pien01 -UserName max_t                                                       
[sapien01]: PS C:\Users\max_t\Documents> 
[sapien01]: PS C:\Users\max_t\Documents> 
[sapien01]: PS C:\Users\max_t\Documents> $PSVersionTable                                                                
[sapien01]: PS C:\Users\max_t\Documents> 
[sapien01]: PS C:\Users\max_t\Documents> 
[sapien01]: PS C:\Users\max_t\Documents> exit  
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

CentOS:
```
PS /home/maxt> cat /etc/os-release                                                                                      
NAME="CentOS Linux"
VERSION="7 (Core)"
ID="centos"
ID_LIKE="rhel fedora"

CENTOS_MANTISBT_PROJECT_VERSION="7"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT="centos"
REDHAT_SUPPORT_PRODUCT_VERSION="7"
```

```powershell
PS /home/maxt> $PSVersionTable                                                                                          

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.2

```
